verses.verse: The word <S%H1697><s%> of Samuel <S%H8050><s%> came to all Israel. <S%H3478><s%> Now Israel <S%H3478><s%> went out <S%H3318><s%> against <S%H7125><s%> the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> to battle, <S%H4421><s%> and encamped <S%H2583><s%> beside Ebenezer: <S%H72><s%> and the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> encamped <S%H2583><s%> in Aphek. <S%H663><s%>

So the people <S%H5971><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> to Shiloh; <S%H7887><s%> and they brought <S%H5375><s%> from there the ark <S%H727><s%> of the covenant <S%H1285><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> of Armies, <S%H6635><s%> who sits <S%H3427><s%> above the cherubim: <S%H3742><s%> and the two <S%H8147><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> of Eli, <S%H5941><s%> Hophni <S%H2652><s%> and Phinehas, <S%H6372><s%> were there with the ark <S%H727><s%> of the covenant <S%H1285><s%> of God. <S%H430><s%>

Woe <S%H188><s%> to us! <S%H5337><s%> Who shall deliver us out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of these mighty <S%H117><s%> gods? <S%H430><s%> These are the gods <S%H430><s%> that struck <S%H5221><s%> the Egyptians <S%H4714><s%> with all kinds of plagues <S%H4347><s%> in the wilderness. <S%H4057><s%>

The Philistines <S%H6430><s%> fought, <S%H3898><s%> and Israel <S%H3478><s%> was struck, <S%H5062><s%> and they fled <S%H5127><s%> every man <S%H376><s%> to his tent: <S%H168><s%> and there was a very <S%H3966><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> slaughter; <S%H4347><s%> for there fell <S%H5307><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> thirty <S%H7970><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> footmen. <S%H7273><s%>

Now Eli <S%H5941><s%> was ninety <S%H8673><s%> - eight <S%H8083><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old; <S%H1121><s%> and his eyes <S%H5869><s%> were set, <S%H6965><s%> so that he could <S%H3201><s%> not see. <S%H7200><s%>

The man <S%H376><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Eli, <S%H5941><s%> "I am he who came <S%H935><s%> out of the army, <S%H4634><s%> and I fled <S%H5127><s%> today <S%H3117><s%> out of the army. <S%H4634><s%>" He said, <S%H559><s%> "How did the matter <S%H1697><s%> go, <S%H1121><s%> my son?"

He <S%H1319><s%> who brought the news answered, <S%H6030><s%> "Israel <S%H3478><s%> has fled <S%H5127><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Philistines, <S%H6430><s%> and there has been also a great <S%H1419><s%> slaughter <S%H4046><s%> among the people. <S%H5971><s%> Your two <S%H8147><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> also, <S%H2652><s%> Hophni and Phinehas, <S%H6372><s%> are dead, <S%H4191><s%> and the ark <S%H727><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> has been captured. <S%H3947><s%>"

It happened, <S%H2142><s%> when he made mention of the ark <S%H727><s%> of God, <S%H430><s%> that Eli fell <S%H5307><s%> from off his seat <S%H3678><s%> backward <S%H322><s%> by <S%H1157><s%> the side <S%H3027><s%> of the gate; <S%H8179><s%> and his neck <S%H4665><s%> broke, <S%H7665><s%> and he died; <S%H4191><s%> for he was an old <S%H2204><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> and heavy. <S%H3513><s%> He had judged <S%H8199><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> forty <S%H705><s%> years. <S%H8141><s%>
